title: Modules loaded with spack don't show up in module list
body:
When loading a module with `spack load` the module doesn't show up in `module list`, however the module still takes effect.

I checked an older system where spack is on version `0.12.1` and there it works, though rolling back to that version didn't help.
The spack git repo also defaults to the `develop` branch, which I found interesting, but checking out `releases/v0.14` also didn't help.

### Spack version
<!-- Add the output to the command below -->
```console
$ spack --version
0.14.0-126-9edf812
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ nvim --version
-bash: nvim: command not found
$ spack load neovim
$ nvim --version
NVIM v0.3.4
[...]
$ module list
No Modulefiles Currently Loaded.
```

### Information on your system

OS: `CentOS 7.7.1908`
Module version: `Modules Release 4.4.0 (2019-11-17)`

The system was just setup, I cloned `https://github.com/spack/spack.git` and activated it with `source /path/to/spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh` in my `.bashrc`

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
